channel.title: CVE Feed for wpbakery -- WPBakery Visual Composer
channel.description: The latest CVEs for wpbakery -- WPBakery Visual Composer

item.title: CVE-2024-1805|2024-05-02T16:52:15.985Z -- wpbakery -- WPBakery Visual Composer
item.description: The wpbakery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the button onclick attribute in all versions up to, and including, 7.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1842|2024-05-02T16:52:12.201Z -- wpbakery -- WPBakery Visual Composer
item.description: The wpbakery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Custom Heading tag attribute in all versions up to, and including, 7.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1840|2024-05-02T16:52:39.691Z -- wpbakery -- WPBakery Visual Composer
item.description: The wpbakery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Post Author tag attribute in all versions up to, and including, 7.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1841|2024-05-02T16:51:58.288Z -- wpbakery -- WPBakery Visual Composer
item.description: The wpbakery plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the Post Title tag attribute in all versions up to, and including, 7.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor access or higher, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
